pain_points_original.title: Safeguarding Sensitive Government Data
pain_points_original.description: DPC must ensure any AI solution rigorously protects sensitive government data. A security failure would erode public trust, create legal liabilities, and disrupt government operations. Safeguarding data, especially with third-party Large Language Models, is a critical, non-negotiable requirement.

pain_points_original.title: Adherence to Public Sector Policies & Regulations
pain_points_original.description: Any AI tool must strictly comply with South Australia's existing ICT, Security, Cyber, and Information Privacy Principles (IPPs) policies. Non-compliance is an absolute barrier to adoption, as it would expose the government to significant legal and reputational risk across all operations.

pain_points_original.title: Boosting Efficiency and Service Delivery
pain_points_original.description: The core driver for this initiative is the need to overcome existing inefficiencies in government operations. DPC is seeking AI solutions to fundamentally improve decision-making, enhance service delivery, increase public satisfaction, and achieve better community outcomes on a large scale.

pain_points_original.title: Integration with Existing Government Systems
pain_points_original.description: The buyer faces the challenge of integrating new AI tools with its existing government systems and platforms. Solutions that cannot adapt and integrate will create data silos and fail to deliver scalable, department-wide benefits, rendering the investment ineffective.

pain_points_original.title: Lack of Proven AI Use Cases in Government
pain_points_original.description: DPC is concerned about the risks of adopting unproven technology. They need evidence of successful AI deployments in similar public sector contexts to validate the technology's effectiveness, learn from best practices, and de-risk their investment before committing to a full-scale rollout.

pain_points_original.title: Budget Uncertainty for AI Solutions
pain_points_original.description: The government lacks clear insight into AI solution costs, which impedes future procurement planning and budget allocation. Without indicative pricing models, they cannot build a robust business case or secure the necessary funding, potentially stalling the entire initiative.

pain_points_original.title: Workforce Skill Gaps and User Adoption Risk
pain_points_original.description: The government needs to understand the training requirements for new AI tools. A significant skill gap among staff could lead to poor user adoption, meaning the expensive technology would be underutilized and fail to deliver the promised efficiency gains and service improvements.
